messages.content: ComfyUI-post-processing-nodes is a collection of post processing nodes for ComfyUI that enable a variety of visually striking image effects.
What effects can be achieved using the AsciiArt node in ComfyUI-post-processing-nodes?
The AsciiArt node in ComfyUI-post-processing-nodes transforms an image into being composed of ASCII characters.
What does the Blur node in ComfyUI-post-processing-nodes do to an image?
The Blur node in ComfyUI-post-processing-nodes applies a Gaussian blur to the input image, softening the details.
How does the CannyEdgeMask node in ComfyUI-post-processing-nodes create a mask?
The CannyEdgeMask node in ComfyUI-post-processing-nodes creates a mask using canny edge detection.
What effect does the Chromatic Aberration node in ComfyUI-post-processing-nodes have on an image?
The Chromatic Aberration node in ComfyUI-post-processing-nodes shifts the color channels in an image, creating a glitch aesthetic.
How does the ColorTint node in ComfyUI-post-processing-nodes affect an image?
The ColorTint node in ComfyUI-post-processing-nodes applies a customizable tint to the input image, with various color modes such as sepia, RGB, CMY and several composite colors.
What does the KuwaharaBlur node in ComfyUI-post-processing-nodes do?
The KuwaharaBlur node in ComfyUI-post-processing-nodes applies an edge preserving blur, creating a more realistic blur than Gaussian.
How can the post-processing nodes be installed for use in ComfyUI?
To install the post-processing nodes for ComfyUI, navigate to the `/ComfyUI/custom_nodes/` folder and run `git clone https://github.com/EllangoK/ComfyUI-post-processing-nodes/`.
